name: King Arthur's Gold
description: Would you enjoy building CASTLES, traps and siege machines in MULTIPLAYER? And then undermine your opponents castle and collapse it with 2D PHYSICS & DESTRUCTION?
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1.5 Ghz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 64MB Integrated Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 256 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core i5 2.1GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 512MB Dedicated Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: This is absolutely brilliant! It's like a turbocharged multiplayer Lemmings. The insanity you get on a 20-player server is hilarious. It really is as crazy as the videos above suggest, but it's better than it looks.  Definitely my multiplayer game of the year 2013!
It's a side-scrolling medieval-themed pixelated game with 3 classes to choose from. It's got fun competitive modes and a really neat gameplay style. I'd suggest getting this game, it's really good.
Smashing people with boulders, riding them over with bisons, launching keg bombs with catapults...Nothing gets better than that!

King Arthur's Gold. Where do we begin?  Let's say you just start in the game. You have no tutorials, you are just thrown into a random game. What do you do? You begin building a fort. You see someone else doing an entirely different thing. Are you doing it wrong? One guy is putting trap blocks over a hole, another is digging a large tunnel with water, another is creating rooms packed with traps and class shops. Who is right and who is wrong?  All of you are right! This game encourages creativity. Using what's around you and turning it against your enemies. A shark in a pit killing soldiers? Turn it into a trap. Enemies built a wall? Launch yourself in a catapult. It is all these different ways to play that make every game so fun.   Assume they are putting heavy siege upon your walls. Off the top of my head, you can: - Build tunnels for a constant stream of defense. - Fill a boat with explosives and ram it into them.  - Get a boat full of builders to destroy the small base they built. - Build walls behind the wall that is under siege - Dozens of more ways, for you to discover! To counter these: - Have builders climb up using ladders to destroy the tunnel. - Sacrifice yourself by turning the boat back into their wall, toppling it over into their base.  - Knights to stab the builders. - Put your catapult on a boat for a constant push on each wall.  TL:DR, King Arthurs gold is a fun game that encourages creativity to defeat your enemies. 9/10

Forget Battlefield, forget all those shooter Minecraft clones, this game is THE KING of building and destruction. The absolute carnage of a capture the flag game is amazing, watching towers fall to the ground and piles a corpses dot the barren battlefield is almost whimsical. Please give this game a shot, it needs more players really bad, i would recommend getting it on sale though. Overall King Arthur's gold is a really fun chaotic 2d multiplayer builder, it's something you can just play on a bored weekend day or play for hours every day overall 8.5/10

This is my first review of any game so I'm just going to start out with the basics.  Pros:  -Three diverse classes to choose from, each with there own specific roles. -Fairly easy to build.  -Not much cookie cutting of any blocks.  -Each block can be used for more than just its intended purpose, increasing the possiblities for building. -Numerous maps -Archer gets an awesome grappling hook! -Knight gets to blow people up! -Builder can drop boulders on face! -Diverse selection of vehicles  Cons: -Nothing determines what players you go against (You could end up with team full of people who have played less then 5 hours of the game, Or end up against people who've played over 100 hours) -Toxic community -Steep learning curve -Controls aren't very good(If you spam stab as a knight to much, it will cause him to just keep stabbing over and over and over again till at some point he stops. Or as the builder, you try to destroy some stone on the wall, you end up destroying the ladder your standing on.) -Not very many game types to choose from(CTF, Take the Halls, Zombies, and Team deathmatch but barely anyone plays anything other than CTF) -Still a few pretty bad glitches (probably only for mac though)  Summary: This is a really fun game that has a few rough edges, but still great fun with friends and random strangers alike. Unfortunatly, the community is pretty toxic and you will probably be going against pros most of the times (pro knights are such a pain, and are almost completly unstoppable). If you give yourself time to get good and can ingore the toxic players, then you'll really enjoy this selection!  P.S. sorry for my bad grammar and spelling and less then pro game critic skills
Cool game, ♥♥♥♥♥♥ community
Singleplayer: holy ♥♥♥♥, Im amazing. Online multiplayer: how do I walk?  Easy to learn, hard to master.
Marry a bison and kill your enemies.

This is a great game:  -I lived in australia and now the uk and to be honest UKS community is more... agressive to all players unlike australias  -Good pixelated graphics  -Fun  -Used to have more players ;-;

King Arthur's Gold is one of those games where most people you play with are a lot better than you. The first few hours of the game are fun and hilarious but after a few more hours the hilarity rubs off and you struggle to get the same enjoyment. If you get enough practice and learn the ins and outs of the game you can enjoy it once more but only if you pass the learning curve.
Awesome game. Well balanced with lots of great content. Definatley worth the money!
Awesome multiplayer game.
Mods from the gods
Chivalry + Terraria = King Arthur's Gold. Awesome game.
I made a shark and a bull fight. (And there's the amazing gameplay, but that's not as important) 10/10 game.

This is exactly the game that i've been looking for.  Fun gameplay, Nice features, a real medieval rpg building fighting sidescrolling chicken flying simulator.  Recommend it for thise who love pixel games  rate : 10/10  Pros : as said above Cons : Theres no Asian based server, so the ping for Asian is quite high. But, its still playable. And it need to be played in Multiplayer to enjoy the full feature.

Really fun but also rage-inducing at times because of a tendency for players to be incompetent and/or extremely dickish. The gameplay is amazing and really fun but sometimes it is ruined by other players. I want more people to play although no more ♥♥♥♥♥ added in please.
It's super fun, definitely worth the dollas.

This is a really cool game, It's like Terraria and Chivalry I love the games with these graphics, unique, awesome and pretty, but, the community of this game is a shame, there're a few servers and the most have lag.  So...        King Arthur's Gold       Good   The game is awesome, the graphics are simple and unique, like Terraria or SNES games, in Chivalry you need to choose a class to fight the enemy, in KAG you need to choose a class between archer, worker or warrior, they are easy to control and depends on your style you can choose anyone       Bad   As I said, the community is poor and the servers on which you can play are few       Rating   8/10
One of the best games I've ever played. Looks ♥♥♥♥ but takes time to master.
This game plays itself never the same. It's actionpacked and full of ingenuity!
Really really fun game, fast paced, chill and in the same time with alot action, imo something like terraria+tf2+mount and blade. Good for achievements also

After nearly 700 hours of playing KAG I realized I hadn't written a review yet...  It's a very, very fun game.  The combat system is for me what makes this game really special. I have spent most of my time in game practicing knight combat. If you like fighting games such as Smash Bros then the combat here will likely appeal to you a lot. The knight has only a few skills, but there are a huge number of ways in which they can be combined. There is little better feeling in this game than going on a huge kill streak.  As the best games should be - it is simple to learn but takes many, many hours to master!  There is a small but very dedicated community. Don't worry about there not being enough players. It only takes around 12 players for a good game of capture the flag, or just 6 for team deathmatch. At the time of writing there are always 60-100 players online.

Definatly worth a buy, this game is great to play when your bored. you never know what'll happen each game and it can get really chaotic but that just adds to the fun! it might seem a little dificult at first, especially if your playing as the knight. but it will get easier to stay alive with practice.

it is a really good game it just needs a single player battle so you don't have to go online and have choices of difficulty and it should be the same as multiplayer just not online and have online aswell
KAG is a bit like a 2-D Sidescrolling Chivalry, with different gamemodes and RP servers that ban you for doing nothing. It's simple yet fun (except for the RP servers). Go ahead and try it out.
Best fun and action packed platformer!
Is a great game, although shrek is not included so 2/10

This is a good game it has some potential. The fighting mechanics are decent as you can be a knight an unstopable killing force with bombs at your disposal. Or you can be an archer who has a grappling hook that you can use to parkour around and shoot people from trees. You can also crouch as an archer which makes you look like your dead so I have feighed my death many times to get past enemy lines. Lastly you can be a builder to make traps with spikes or make a castle for the rest of your team and then change classes while your traps rack up kills. In General these are the good things about this game.  Good combat: If you have decent amount of skill you can pretty much be a god with a sword or an Archer who can parkour around. Fun Buildings: Spikes, tree choppers, catapults, ballistas, those are the buildings in the game that you can use to farm kills and make an impenatrable fortress. Flaws of this Game Needs a Larger Community: More players! It is rare to find a game with more than 8 people in it, Even then those eight people will leave and their is no-one to replace them.  Upgrade Mechanic. You have to vote to choose what upgrades to use, and the system is somewhat difficult for a team to decide what to use. This may have been an old bug but You are unable to build the mounted bow turret. Overall this is a good game with the steam sale and the fighting mechanics you shoud try it.

Knights with swords, Archers with bows, Builders that can build anything from deadly traps to gigantic castles, and...explosions! What's not to love in an entirely multiplayer CO-OP medieval game filled with shark riding, bison taming, explosions, sword duels, more explosions, naval warfare, catapults and ballistas, even more explosions, sniper duels, explosive arrows, burning buildings, and so much more.  Some say the community is dead, but you can still find a full server in every region every day.

Really great game, controls are great. Fun to play with friends and it's pretty awesome playing as any of the classes. The fun thing about the classes is that none of them are overpowered, you need all the classes to achieve your goal, teamwork is really important. The community is also great, there are many great modded servers so modding is acceptable. I would recommend this game to anybody. The only thing that would need work would be single player, since there isn't much to the story but hey there game is constantly updated so it's cool. 10/10
IN LOVE WITH THIS GAME! Top 10 games of all time for me. It's a blast. best indie multiplayer game period

I have been playing kag for a couple of years (recently transferring over to steam), and it is one addicting game. What originally hooked me on was the building elements, so when I was a newbie I could hang back behind the base and work the mechanics of structure out. When I wanted a harder challenge I would fight as an archer or knight, Where I was treated with lots of deaths as my body was continuously stabbed, shot and blown up. Needless to say Kag has many things for people to experience, it even allows for people to create their own servers and make their own mods.  I have seen some interesting mods such Role-playing, or just bunnies turning into zombies, a overhead view with people making ships to blow each other up, and just different maps if you start getting tired of the old ones.  Did I mention zombies, yeah it's got zombies, mods with zombies, yep got that too.  and for those who don't always want to play with others there is a sandbox mode for you to go and play around in( or that role-playing mode as long as you don't make anyone mad, and A save the princess mode where you fight through several maps too save a dazzling beauty. Oh and tell me if you find princess geti :D  Pro's: -Multiplayer  -Sandbox  -Mods  -Many Maps  -Fun community  -Boats and ships  -Princess Geti ( Remember this is very important)  -Zombies  Cons:-Griefers  -Relying on others to be on for Multiplayer  -People who take the game way too seriously  And Remember to find that princess

Vary fun if you have good players. But needs to have voice chat. Alot of things happen at the same time like a knight carrying a big bomb while archers are climbing you castle. Vary late game can be fun too. But it can be cheep at times. Like a builder going to your castle and breaking your walls useing hes pickaxe or a knight with a drill. Vary funny game, I give it a 7.8

A great game for those who love good ol' sword and shield style fighting in a 2D sidescrolling environment.  9/10

2013 Game of the Year, hands down.  With apologies to Risk of Rain - it was pretty close.  King Arthur's Gold is just absolutely wonderful. From the lovely chiptune music to the diversity of the classes, to the way the map transforms over time and eventually collapses into the ocean, it's an almost perfect red vs blue game and one of the best retro games I've ever played.  There are only three classes, but what's so nice about them is they vary in playstyle, skill ceiling, and complexity. This is a game good and bad players can enjoy together. It's a game kids and adults can play against each other.  The knight is essentially pick up & play, very easy to learn and difficult to cause problems for teammates while learning. The archer is a bit more advanced but allows for players still getting their bearings (or who just aren't very good) to stay reliably out of harm's way while still contributing to the team objective.  For the advanced player, the builder has a complex range of tools, materials, and duties which are the meat & potatoes of this game, because it's the builder who makes the fortifications and defenses, designs the traps, determines the base layout, and is crucial to the infiltration of the enemy base. There is also resource management to consider here.  All of this stuff can lead to long contests, and in fact the map can become so wrecked that there's a 'map ruined' option under the vote menu. This slow destruction of the level is more fun than it sounds, though. If one side decides to hold out and refuses the reset vote, you'll see pitched battles underwater, hunts in the collapsing and flooding tunnel systems, and probably more drowning than you'll encounter in all your other games combined.  The end result of all this delicious chaos is a rambling, relaxing mashup of Fat Princess, Ace of Spades, Worms, Terraria; and of course the great forgotten SNES classic King Arthur's World, from which KAG took much of its inspiration.  I cannot lavish enough praise on this game. There's even a solid co-op zombie mod if you haven't tired of zombies yet, complete with deep base building and boss portals to destroy. It's a surprisingly slow-paced and often suspenseful take on the genre, the likes of which we haven't seen since Urban Dead. Certainly not for everyone, but worth mention.  The rest of this game though -  that's  for everyone. Nobody should be without KAG. It's as good as multiplayer gets.

This game used to be one of the best I'd ever played. HOWEVER I will say that some mechanic changes and shifts among the community have caused me to stop playing altogether. Sometimes i will launch this game, muck around for 10 mins then remember why i stopped playing.  That said, this is a very, very good game. The combat will drive you insane at first and the learning curve causes a lot of new players to give up, but get through it you will experience a time of pure bliss within the game. Stick with it and you will have a great time.  9/10
An extremely fun game IMHO!  If you have a fade interest in a 'terraria pvp' kind of game look no further

I think this game has alot of good addictive action. It never gets repetitive and you can explore alot of things. The biggest thing i enjoyed was probably CTF because in CTF you have to build to protect your flags. Buildings can be built however you want. You can use your smartness to include some blocks that could trap the enemy or make only your team be able to use it. You can also mine and dig tunnels or go in offensive building agains the enemy. Since Physics is included you can knock down theyre building and then get the flag. As a knight you have 3 attack types Normal slash, Heavy slash and Double Heavy Slash. Knights can also like the builder buy things. As builders can buy Drills, Sawmills, sponges, lanterns and buckets and trampolines Knights can buy Bombs, Waterbombs, Mines and Kegs. Also the Archer class can be very usefull He has two attacks a normal shot at any strength or a tripple or double or one heavy shot. Archers can also buy arrows. E.g Fire arrows for setting wood on fire and water arrows to stun Also most deadly the bomb arrows to explode enmy defences. This game also included boats which can be sailed across the waters and used as faster transport or just siege weapons and spawn location E.g the big warboat that can fire Explosive balista bolts and used as a spawn point. Also it has a massive ram in ht efront preventing enemys from entering the ship or going above past the ship. The type of blocks in this game are also Dirt, Dirt walls, Stone, Stone walls, Wood, Wood walls, Platforms , Trap blocks, Spikes , Stone Doors, Wood Doors, Bedrock, Stone ore, Larger Stone ore, Ladder and workshops. I reccomend this game as it is very intresting , fun and addictive i hope this helped you get a better idea

Hugely addictive game where you can build, shoot, and be a sword guy. It's pretty much a platformer but with Terraria building and a somewhat engaging combat with the swords. They made the bow shooting a bit harder/different, too. It is either incredeibly intense and strategic or you get steam rolled.

It's like Towerfall but with an expansion. Soldiers, Archers, and Builders. Archery is more fun in Towerfall, but the other mixes and items add to the fun level of KaG. Active multiplayer(at least every time I have been on.) and got it for $3 so pretty happy about that. I enjoy it, although it is starting to get dull already, it's a fun casual game to jump into until I see the Towerfall Ascension go on sale more to get it. :)
terraria meets chivlary and then this game born.   10/10. must have

I still continue to play it after over 2 years, and i have to say it is worth every penny.  Almost two years after i first wrote this review, and i still continue to play it. If youre looking for a fun game to throw endless hours of your life into, let it be this game.

And when I was trying to build something, everyone was yelling at me and pretty much spouting an ocean of profanity. Even though I explained i was new multiple times.   But the game is still very good in my opinion. It has multiple hours of replayability, and trying new strategies.   But the community is trash.   Like me.   10/10

This game is good and has some awesome ideas going for it, too bad a lot of them fall flat due to balancing issues or the hit or miss community. I love the ideas of building epic structures and working together with your team to take them down with siege weaponry and cunning, unfortunately this is not usually how the matches end up. You'll go into a game hoping to create a grand structure, but you'll be one of two, or maybe the only, builder and it's just not possible to build anything large by yourself, you simply can't gather and hold enough resources to create it before the enemy shows up. And then they do... wave after wave of knights carrying keg bombs, just laying waste to your creations. Who needs a catapult when a cheap as dirt explosive does twice the damage? It's stupid, makes no sense, and ruins most matches. Then there's the lag, I'm not sure if it's happening to anyone else, but i meet the requirements to run the game and it does run very smoothly when I'm playing alone, but then i hit the servers and it all goes to hell. The match will start off fairly smooth, but then it will degrade as the match goes on. By the end I'm moving at slideshow speeds of a frame every couple seconds. MY ping is between 30-100 most days so i really don't know what's going on. I really have to wonder how people with higher pings even manage to stomach it. I tried turning on faster graphics and that literally made things worse, when it is supposed to speed them up. I find it difficult to recommend the game, but i will as if the problems i've described are fixed it will be a great title. Right now as it stands it's either fun as hell or oh-my-god-someone-give-me-a-gun-I'm-going-to-kill-that-son-of-a- kind of experience depending on your luck at the servers. So if we could just raise the cost of keg bombs, decrease their damage, get a bigger player base, and fix the framerates this game would be excellent.
recommended
I like the creativity this game offers.. and all in all It's pretty good.  Also the community is one of the friendliest communities I've ever seen. (Yes, 'friendliest' is word)

This game is surprisingly fun. If you liked Soldat, you'll love King Arthur's Gold. I never thought that the creators of Soldat would be making a game like this, and so avaliable. I spent hours playing Soldat, I think I'll be spending many more hours playing K.A.G.

Fantastic game, build, shoot and hack your way to victory. The game appears simple but there is a lot to it and it takes a while to master. Watching an enemy castle collapse is very satisfying. Great value.

This game has definitly been worth the money when I bought it, and for the 2 years aftwerwards. Whether it is worth it now is hard to say for some of you, but to me I think it is. The community is still staying pretty much strong and more mods are coming out. The game is fun if you get into it and take the time to learn some of the things it has to offer (learning is not to long, and even then its worth. Trust me.) All these people with their negative reviews only bought it when the DDoS was happening, got butthurt, and didn't both to change the review after it was fixed. The game would have a review up at about 92% without all these crap reviews, easily. It is a masterpiece of a game that keeps giving and giving no matter how many years pass by. It is an infinite supply of joy and entertainment that I have been blessed to have enjoyed for 3 years. The community is great, and you will be able to find some KAG friends in no time. Hell, it might even be me. I have somehow managed to build a close connection to this game. It sounds really weird but there is just something about it, I don't know what by I am always compelled to play it even if there are no servers i like or if its empty. Maybe thats just the huge amount of hours talking though. To put it in one sentence, get it, I think its very good, only 10 bucks. Thanks for taking the time to read my enermous review, if you survived this far.
Pretty sweet game
Its hard to find any 10 dollar game that is better than this. or even a 60 dollar game for that matter
An often overlooked game that is very addictive!

an incredibly fun fast paced pvp based game, with an incredibly friendly community. the corntrolls are simple, matches usualy dont last longer than 5 minuets, it is a great game that is suprisingly deep.

King Arthur's Gold is quite a good game. It takes the building mechanics of Terraria, mashes it in with blood lust and vehicles, and then adds just a touch of- oh no- that is way more than a touch! IT IS FREAKING CHAOTIC AND INSANE AND FUN! I can't explain it completely, but no match is the same. There are three stages to every match. The building stage, marked by a grace period to build and stuff, the... in-between phase, marked by people dashing around just trying to make enough cash to buy a massive bomb, and the final phase, marked by someone actually managing to coordinate an attack, which ends up decimating the other team and making an insane war-zone of death and chaos.  The only con I can think of is the very chaos that makes it so original. When you start playing, it is incredibly confusing, and you end up failing a lot. Because of this, this game isn't for everyone, but if you can push past that bit, King Arthur's Gold is truly a gem.
10/10 taming bison with burgers is fun

Amazing game worth your money, I have little hours on steam but I have played over 1000 hours easily (I use KAG through screen desktop) I have also played the KAG classic which is a big step up from that, its a fun game sorta like TF2 but medieval and their isn't trading. Their hasn't been any big 'game chaning' updates for a long time as Geti (one of the developers) said that their done with that sort of stuff and are just doing bug fixes/patches from now on. I feel as though KAG has way more potentional then they have given it but maybe their will be a KAG 2 one day? lots of people still play and it hasn't died! so I highly recommended buying this game if you believe you will play it, it also has a small (but reasonable) competitive scene if you're into that kinda thing too!

In this game you can flex with a single button press.  But in all seriousness, it's great chaotic multiplayer fun. Very simple mechanics that turn into deep strategies. And you can ride buffalo and drop sharks into the enemy base. Cannot recommend enough.

This game game is the perfect definition of an action packed sidescroller. Don't be fooled by the pixel graphics. The lighting effects from explosions and torches will truly make this game appealing. The controls are easy to adapt to from the classic WSAD format. Along with the controls, there are many button combos that can perform dash moves, devestating attacks, and quick escapes. The classes are a main feature in this game. There's the knight, the archer, and the builder. The builder is essentially the heart of the team. This class can build war machines, defenses, castles, spawn stations, and tunnels through the desrtuctible enviroment of the map. The knight is the one that charges in hacking and slashing. They have the ability to use bombs and several sword attacks. And don't forget the shield, an important factor in combat. The archer is the ranged attacker. With light armor and a deadly bow and arrow, the archer is quick and deadly. This class has the classic bow and arrow, but also a grappling hook, for daring advances and quick escapes. Another great future is the destructible enviroment. The bombs launched by kinghts will leave holes below your feet along with blood and dismembered limbs. Arrows will stick to everything, including human flesh. The gamemodes are fun and creative like the Create-Your-Own Castle and defend it (Take the Halls), Team Deathmatch, CTF, Zombie Fortress, and Challenges (minigames). Overall, its a really fun and unique take on the claasic side scrolling genre that I believe everyone will enjoy. 8/10

I think this game puts a lot of emphasis on Multiplayer. I most of the time realise this before the purchase, especially when I see the 4-packs available. I was looking for more a single player experiance, but there is just not enough content for me to play it all that much on single player... ...But if you have the time, and people to play with, highly recomended.

After 56 hours, I'm writing a review for this game.  First off, the servers are far from dead. Quite the opposite. The game has a large base of players (many with hundreds or thousands of hours). However, they are often very accepting of newbies on the newer servers. It takes some time to get skilled. I'm far from a pro at the time of writing this review.   First off, there is a very tactical base for the game. With larger teams and maps, it requires strategy to take down a large fort. With smaller teams, the buildings may get smaller but the tactical base stays.  I could go way into detail, or you could buy it and have a couple hundred hours of fun.  I suggest the latter.
Imagine Terraria, Team Fortress 2, and Orcs Must Die; that is this game. Its like a crackbaby of all three of those games combined into one loving' spoon full!
Great game. Combat is fun, building is well-balanced and the destruction means that even playing the same maps over and over again doesn't get old. good community aswell.

The game is very unique and does a few things differently from other games. For example, communicating with other players is very easy and quick with a radial emoticon/arrow menu that can be pulled out at the press of the button. The gameplay is very fun and addicting - launching yourself from a catapult, riding a shark or a buffalo into opponents' faces, sneaking in the enemy base in an underground tunnel with an explosive keg, etc. I highly recommend King Arthur's Gold, there's no game like it.

EASILY WORTH EVERY PENNY. The game itself looks terrible which I actually love since most everything else is just a very polished version of something done 1000 times over. There are3 different classes knight, archer, and builder, but a bit of a learning curve. For the price there is enough here to keep you entertained for a little while at least. For me...2D pvp has not been this fun for a very long time.

If there's any testimony to how great this game is, it's the fact that it's addictive despite having no form of progression system (no XP, no items to unlock, etc.). You  never  spend time to acquire items/abilities throughout your career, which is a huge plus for some.  The trailer shows the realistic potential of gameplay with capable players pretty well. Gameplay is deceptively deep (learn the details), mechanics are fully-fleshed and coherent, aesthetics are great for what they try to be, and the game is simply fun.  For 10 USD, this game is a great value.  Note: The singleplayer mini-campaign is more or less a tutorial, the multiplayer is the actual game. There aren't that many players playing at a given time, but I can consistently find servers with people and good ping with almost no issue (NE USA). Also,  steamcharts.com  may not give an accurate number of concurrent players since this game also has a non-Steam version (Both versions are cross-compatible).

It's a nice concept. As soon as I saw the graphics, my childhood popped in, when I loved all kinds of cross-section books. (Like Stephen Biesty's Cross-Sections Castle). Unfortunately the gameplay - while it has the potential - gets booring really soon, in like 2-3 days. The building aspect of the game works great in terms of engine technology, but the balance between building and destruction is like 1:10 to destruction. It's too easy to destroy anything you build, so people usually don't take time to build nice and strategicly planned forts, because it's not worth of your time. The game is much more about bruteforce and not creative strategy.

I highly recommend anybody thinking of purchasing this game save your money. The community is tiny, most of the servers always empty, and there is good reason for it. Every server with a population is overrun by toxic players and enabling 'admins', if you can call some of the kids they put in charge administrators. Admins enable their friends griefing, some of them grief themselves. The vote kick/ban system has no memory, so the toxic players just come back the next day even if they are removed one day for bad actions. No global ban list, no meaningful moderation by adults. The classes that were once reasonably well balanced are now unbalanced so badly a single player can hero-mode through entire castles/teams. It's really not worth any amount of money at this point, far better similar games out there - I would suggest one of those.  This is an example of a game that could have been a fun, long-lasting 2d platformer. Instead it goes permanently in the recycle bin.

At first this game looks very promising. It's a pity the only included single player campaign is designed only around the Knight.  Multiplayer will actually play out much like modern FPS games. Yes, there are rocket jumping knights in this game. Here are the unique abilities of each class:  Archer: Grappling Hook, Charge Attack (fires 3 arrows if you keep clicking), Fire 4 arrow types (normal, water, fire, bomb). Builder: Mine, Build, Deconstruct. Builders make all things including workshops to manufacture items for the other classes. Knight: Block, Charge Attack (breaks through block, usually killing the other knight if you know how to cheat, and I don't), Use Bombs (water and explosive), use heavy demolition, fly with shield (further with chicken), bomb jump, weaker deconstruct (knights can chop through wood and dirt, but must bomb through stone). They can also surf over rough terrain using their shield.   As you can imagine most multiplayer sessions devolve into rushing for bombs and demolitions and then most players switch to knights because they are so overpowered. The game could be much better than what it is with a few simple changes to the knight (remove charge attack, have shield only block arrows and melee, make stone blocks tougher, remove supply drops). But as it stands the combat oriented players will win every time over builders and their traps.  It would also be nice if you could make a custom castle or fortress and then use that at the beginning of every game rather than having to rebuild it at the start of each new game. Sadly I cannot recommend the game in its current state, which feels very pre-alpha to me.  Edit: I forgot to add that very occasionally you will hear a strange glitchy (loud) noise and every member of your team will die. There is some cheating in this game. Be warned.

The single player isn't worth much...the multiplayer on the otherhand is alot of fun. Downside is people seem to think they are playing a ranked match of some sort and you'll pretty much end up getting banned from a server by making a mistake without even getting the chance to explain yourself. You misclick a keg or you die to the enemy and they take your keg. You could get banned and not alot of servers....only 3 really ever have a good number of players in them at any one time. It is an amazing game and i would love to see this game really big. The community right now just kinda kills it...

This is a very multi-player-oriented game. It does offer single player features, but they are very lacking; A massive sandbox world would be nice, rather than the 20-seconds to reach the end map it offers in single-player. Additionally, there are no random encounters as far as I've seen in single-players sandbox.  If you want a nice single player sandbox, this definitely is not for you. If you want to spend all of your time online, it's probably really good; unfortunately, some people, like myself, have too laggy of internet to enjoy such things.

Expected fun and responsive multiplayer combat with a tutorial to multiplayer that covers more than the very basics, was disappointed. Multiplayer is not noob friendly at all and there are griefers. Having to get close against faster moving knights to actually hurt them as ranged character sucks when they can easily block your shot and follow it with a faster strike (because your bow charge is slow and slows you down). The combat doesn't feel responsive at all because of delays - When you are a lone archer/knight fighting against grouped enemy behind doors, there's not much you can do.  The princess rescue mission and challenges didn't tell how to effectively build traps or various other things. I feel like I could learn the game and it's classes if I kept playing, but having to do so in multiplayer environment with experienced players isn't very nice.

I remember playing this game a while back, and thoroughly enjoying it (i never got the full version, however). So when I saw KAG on steam, I was like 'oh boy a game that i liked better go buy it'. When it downloaded, I opened it and already ran into a bug; the game's window was bugged. I went to the options panel on the menu, but nothing. Nothing about fullscreen or the resolution, just controls and other nonsense. It took me 5 minutes to find on google that you had to change it BEFORE pressing play on the little window that pops up. Why not just put it in the settings? Is it some sort of limitation on the software used to create the game?  So, after fixing up my resolution, I decide to play a little bit of sandbox. And god it's horrible. Back in the old time of KAG, it had a simple building layout, with 8 things on it. Simple and easy. Now you have all these wires and lamps and other bullcrap that don't actually need using.   WHAT THE HELL IS WIRE DOING IN A MEDIEVAL GAME, ANYWAY?   I couldn't even select things properly, they just select themself when you scroll over them. This is when I quit. Honestly, I couldn't give two damns about the community, I just want that damn build menu fixed. Until then, I'm going to have to give this a 2/10.     why must you hurt me in this way

One of the most underrated games. As of writing this I can't recommend it because they have changed things that I don't personally like to cater to the more elite crowd - and all the elite crowd does is use macros. In order to actually completely please that crowd though, I think they would have to redesign the game.  With that said, it was definitely fun and worth the money. I was always able to find a full server, even if that meant playing on overseas servers, although you risk getting temp-banned for high ping (rare though, but be aware that you should have a good internet connection).  Pros:   Explosives & dynamic options to leverage physics (bomb jumping if you shield down on a bomb, for example)   Castle building with interesting mechanics including team-only doors, and 2 types of block material   Easy to jump into a game   Plenty of mods, and also completely moddable via LUA Mods include Role-playing modes, extra vehicles and weapons, entirely new games like Shiprekt and Bunnyfection   Relatively fast matches (less so since the update where you can repair over damaged blocks)   Cons:   It can run slowly on a lot of computers, because the code is apparently unoptimized afaik (devs have mentionned they're trying to get this fixed but their company head is slow to approve patches)   Occasional glitches (including animation glitches which are frustrating because they can completely mask what an enemy is holding)   No way to stop macro users (a mouse macro can completely break this game, disagree or not it is actually a bigger problem than some people realize)   I want to give this a thumbs up, but in the current state a lot of matches either go to server crashes or ties which can get kind of boring. You also need a fairly good rig to have this game play smoothly (sorry non-pc master race).  If the pros outweight the cons to you though, this may be worth a buy, it just happens to be right on a tipping point for me though where I can't recommend it to everyone (and I sincerely apologize to the devs, because I think they are actually trying really hard to fix it).

This game is not as awesome as it looks. The graphics are appealing, but that's as far as it goes. Here's a list of things that annoy me:  -Jump is up. Why? Because you travel vertically when you jump, of course! -Ladders are climbed by jumping. It makes sense with the default controls, up to jump, but I changed them. Because pressing up to jump is stupid. -Everything is overcomplicated. If you want to pick stuff up, you hold the pick up key, click on the item, then it sort of floats in front of your character. From there, you open your inventory and drag the item in.  -The sound effect for an enemy warrior dying is the Wilhelm Scream. Every single time.  -The sound effect for picking up a large coin (which, mercifully, is automatic) is the same exact sound used for picking up a coin in Super Mario World.  -Chickens drop nothing. Cows drop nothing. Sharks drop steak. -Don't bother trying to stay on a ladder while swordfighting, because the ladder breaks when you hit it with your sword a few times. -It seems buggy. In the 'Save the princess' mode, I went into a castle and every enemy randomly exploded into blood and body parts for no reason whatsoever.   Of course, lots of people say this game is good. Maybe I'm just nitpicking. But I really, really, wanted to like this game. And I don't.

This was a great game... at first.  But players, the horrible balancing system, etc. really ruin it.  It is a good game, but players ruin the experience.  *update*  I went back to the game and it's still annoying. You can spend an hour on a team then forced to switch sides for balance despite coming in ahead of many other players.  I still can't recommend this game.

The game has a cool multiplayer feature but in order to not get ban from top servers they expect you to have previously browsed the forums for the game for a list of each servers rules and such. This I found out after being ban from 2 of the best servers in my area. I could attempt to appeal it via the webpage but any community that doesn't cut new players slack when the community is already soo small deserves to die out. 2/5 stars
Fun game for a while, now there's only small handfuls of servers. Got banned a few times for replacing wooden doors with stone doors...

It's unfinished, unstable, unplayable. Registration doesn't work - neither in-game nor on the website (where there are two different forms to register, btw). Can't start playing. There's a massive input lag for a mouse cursor, even in the menus. If you let the game use Steam Overlay it flickers. And they're taking money for this. Devs constantly repeat themselves saying they've fixed the Steam authentication issue but it still happens. They've got no clue what they do.
